bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard, January 16, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the U.S. Monrovia Jan 16/87
Returns of the Consular Agency at Elmina Gold Coast for the quarter ending Dec. 31, 1886. Needs of the Consulate.
Returns of the Agency at Elmina-- nes of forms, stationary, plus &c
Consulate General of the U.S. Monrovia Jan. 16/87
Hon. T. F. Bayard, Secretary of State Wasington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully at this my earliest opportunity to forward you the Consular Agency at Elmina report. The returns, please find consist of Digest of the Invoice Book (1), Arrivals and Departures of American vessels (2) Summary of consular Business (3)

Report of official services rendered to American vessels and Seamen (4). I have the honor further to inform you that the Agent is in need of printed forms, stationary, pens, pencils, penholders, envelopmes, sealing-wax &c.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient Servant
Samuel S. Sevier Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
